decks.notes: This deck relies on efficiently discarding cards from your hand to bring out powerful creatures like Hollow One and Flamewake Phoenix early in the game. Using cards like Burning Inquiry and Faithless Looting, you can quickly fill your graveyard with creatures and then bring them back to the battlefield. With a mix of powerful creatures and burn spells like Lightning Bolt, this deck puts pressure on your opponent early and often, aiming to overwhelm them before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier to enable powerful combos with Bridge from Below and Gravecrawler. Vengevine, Bloodghast, and Hangarback Walker can all be brought back from the graveyard for additional pressure, while Walking Ballista and Goblin Bushwhacker provide additional win conditions. Greater Gargadon can be sacrificed to create a board advantage, and the mana base allows for quick access to the necessary colors. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and resilient graveyard-based strategy.

The key idea of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Ad Nauseam, Angel's Grace, and Phyrexian Unlife to draw your entire deck and win the game with Laboratory Maniac. The deck utilizes various mana acceleration cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism, as well as cantrips like Sleight of Hand and Serum Visions to help find the combo pieces quickly. It also includes Pact of Negation to protect the combo from disruption and Lightning Storm as an alternate win condition. The goal is to execute the combo as fast and as efficiently as possible.

This deck focuses on generating a high storm count to cast powerful spells like Grapeshot multiple times in a single turn. It utilizes cards like Pyromancer Ascension, Manamorphose, and rituals to generate mana and card advantage, while also using cards like Gifts Ungiven to search for combo pieces. By chaining spells together and building a critical mass of storm count, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of burn spells and win the game in a single explosive turn. Additionally, cards like Goblin Electromancer and Baral, Chief of Compliance help reduce the cost of spells and increase the efficiency of the combo.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and removal spells while ramping up its mana with spells like Search for Tomorrow and Sakura-Tribe Elder. The ultimate goal is to play Scapeshift, sacrificing lands to search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and multiple Mountains, dealing massive amounts of damage to the opponent in one turn. Bring to Light allows for flexibility in searching for key spells, while cards like Cryptic Command provide additional control over the game. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponent until it can win with a game-ending Scapeshift combo.

The main concept of this deck is to play aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. By combining efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide with powerful burn spells such as Lightning Bolt and Boros Charm, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel punish opponents for playing spells, further pressuring them to act quickly or risk taking damage. This deck's strategy revolves around dealing damage quickly and efficiently to win the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive play and dealing damage quickly to the opponent. Using efficient spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Atarka's Command, combined with powerful creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. With a mix of burn spells and creatures with haste, this deck aims to be fast and relentless in its assault, aiming to win the game before the opponent has a chance to execute their game plan.

The deck focuses on using counter spells and board wipes to control the game. It includes removal spells like Path to Exile and Cryptic Command to deal with threats, as well as card draw with Serum Visions and Hieroglyphic Illumination. The win condition comes from powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, along with creature beats from Celestial Colonnade. Crucible of Worlds provides additional value by recurring lands like Field of Ruin for disruption. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through control and attrition.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Amulet of Vigor and Azusa, Lost But Seeking, to play Primeval Titan as early as possible. Primeval Titan can search for key lands such as Vesuva and Tolaria West to set up powerful combos, allowing the player to quickly overwhelm their opponent with strong creatures like Zacama, Primal Calamity and Hornet Queen. The deck also includes tools for card draw and protection, making it a versatile and powerful combo deck in the Modern format.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with +1/+1 counters. By utilizing Hardened Scales and various modular creatures, the deck aims to create a snowball effect where each creature entering the battlefield becomes significantly more powerful. The deck includes cards like Walking Ballista and Steel Overseer to further enhance the power of the creatures on the battlefield. The goal is to consistently put pressure on the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on flooding the board with aggressive Human creatures, utilizing cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant to quickly pump them up. Aether Vial allows for creatures to be put into play at instant speed, while disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter disrupt opponents' game plans. The deck also includes powerful flying creatures like Mantis Rider for added reach. The lands and mana base are optimized for casting Humans efficiently, maximizing the synergy between the creatures and the tribal synergies present in the deck.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient removal spells like Path to Exile, Fatal Push, Abrupt Decay, and useful hand disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to clear the way for powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf, Grim Flayer, and Kalitas. Lingering Souls provides additional threats and helps to control the board, while Traverse the Ulvenwald helps to find key creatures or lands. The Planeswalkers Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope offer further disruption and value, making the deck a strong aggro option in Modern.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble pieces such as Krark-Clan Ironworks, Scrap Trawler, and Ichor Wellspring to generate infinite mana and draw through the deck with Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. It uses various artifacts and mana producers to loop through the deck, generate value, and overwhelm the opponent with infinite combos. The deck thrives on finding its combo pieces quickly using cards like Mishra's Bauble and Ancient Stirrings, while also having interaction and protection with Engineered Explosives and Sai, Master Thopterist. It aims to win the game in a single explosive turn.

The main concept of this Aggro - Red Deck Wins archetype is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through low-cost and efficient burn spells, as well as aggressive creatures that can attack early and often. The deck focuses on maximizing damage output while maintaining a high level of aggression and pressure on the opponent, with a lean mana base to ensure consistent and fast plays. This deck aims to finish the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize or mount a defense, utilizing a combination of burn spells and creatures to overwhelm and defeat the opponent.

The deck focuses on using a combination of efficient removal spells, counterspells, board wipes, and powerful planeswalkers to establish control over the game. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while drawing cards and managing threats to eventually win through incremental advantage or a strong planeswalker ultimate. The deck utilizes a mana base that allows for consistent casting of its spells and can quickly transition from defense to offense with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria.

The main concept of this deck is to use the Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle land and a combination of ramp spells and creatures to quickly assemble enough lands to cast Scapeshift and search for Valakut and Mountains, dealing massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The deck utilizes cards like Primeval Titan, Farseek, and Wood Elves to accelerate land drops and ensure the combo can be executed as quickly as possible. The inclusion of Lightning Bolt and other removal spells helps control the game until the combo can be executed.
